Package camzup.pfriendly

Class UpOgl

java.lang.Object
processing.core.PImage
processing.core.PGraphics
processing.opengl.PGraphicsOpenGL
camzup.pfriendly.UpOgl
All Implemented Interfaces:
IUp, IUpOgl, java.lang.Cloneable, PConstants
Direct Known Subclasses:
Up3, Yup2
public abstract class UpOgl
extends PGraphicsOpenGL
implements IUpOgl
An abstract parent class for Processing renderers based on OpenGL.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface camzup.pfriendly.IUpOgl

    • arc

      public void arc​(float x0, float y0, float x1, float y1, float start, float stop, int mode)
      Draws an arc at a location from a start angle to a stop angle. The meaning of the first four parameters depends on the renderer's ellipseMode.
      Overrides:
      arc in class PGraphics
      Parameters:
      x0 - the first x
      y0 - the first y
      x1 - the second x
      y1 - the second y
      start - the start angle
      stop - the stop angle
      mode - the arc mode

      Overrides:
      bezierTangent in class PGraphics
      Parameters:
      ap0 - the first anchor point
      cp0 - the first control point
      cp1 - the second control point
      ap1 - the second anchor point
      step - the step

    • colorCalc

      public void colorCalc​(float x, float y, float z, float a, boolean premul)
      Exposes the color calculation to the public. Includes the option to premultiply alpha. Refers to the helper function colorPreCalc(float, float, float, float) to perform part of the calculation independent of this consideration.
      Parameters:
      x - the first color channel, hue or red
      y - the second color channel, saturation or green
      z - the third color channel, brightness or blue
      a - the alpha channel
      premul - pre-multiply alpha
      See Also:
      colorPreCalc(float, float, float, float)

    • colorMode

      public void colorMode​(int mode, float max1, float max2, float max3, float maxA)
      Sets the renderer's color mode. Color channel maximums should be a positive value greater than or equal to one.
      Overrides:
      colorMode in class PGraphics
      Parameters:
      mode - the color mode, HSB or RGB
      max1 - the first channel maximum, hue or red
      max2 - the second channel maximum, saturation or green
      max3 - the third channel maximum, brightness or blue
      maxA - the alpha channel maximum

    • colorPreCalc

      public void colorPreCalc​(float x, float y, float z, float a)
      A helper function to color calculation, exposed to the public. Calculates color based on the color mode, HSB or RGB, regardless of whether or not the color is to be pre-multiplied.
      Parameters:
      x - the first color channel, hue or red
      y - the second color channel, saturation or green
      z - the third color channel, brightness or blue
      a - the alpha channel

    • model

      public Vec3 model​(Vec3 point, Vec3 target)
      Processing's modelX, modelY and modelZ functions are very inefficient, as each one calculates the product of the modelview and the point. This function groups all three model functions into one.
      Parameters:
      point - the input point
      target - the output point
      Returns:
      the model space point

    • rotateX

      public void rotateX​(float angle)
      Rotates the sketch by an angle in radians around the x axis. Do not use sequences of ortho-normal rotations by Euler angles; this will result in gimbal lock. Instead, rotate by an angle around an axis.
      Overrides:
      rotateX in class PGraphicsOpenGL
      Parameters:
      angle - the angle
      See Also:
      rotate(float, float, float, float)

    • updateGLModelview

      public void updateGLModelview​(float m00, float m01, float m02, float m03, float m10, float m11, float m12, float m13, float m20, float m21, float m22, float m23, float m30, float m31, float m32, float m33)
      Exposes the OpenGL model view array to more direct access.
      Parameters:
      m00 - row 0, column 0
      m01 - row 0, column 1
      m02 - row 0, column 2
      m03 - row 0, column 3
      m10 - row 1, column 0
      m11 - row 1, column 1
      m12 - row 1, column 2
      m13 - row 1, column 3
      m20 - row 2, column 0
      m21 - row 2, column 1
      m22 - row 2, column 2
      m23 - row 2, column 3
      m30 - row 3, column 0
      m31 - row 3, column 1
      m32 - row 3, column 2
      m33 - row 3, column 3
